quoteText: Universe,just admire it,its the best you could do with it anyways.
author: Dr Manhattan

quoteText:
Voilà! 
 In view, a humble vaudevillian veteran cast vicariously as both victim and villain by the vicissitudes of Fate. This visage, no mere veneer of vanity, is a vestige of the vox populi, now vacant, vanished. However, this valorous visitation of a bygone  vexation stands vivified and has vowed to vanquish these venal and virulent vermin vanguarding vice and vouchsafing the violently vicious and voracious violation of volition! The only verdict is vengeance; a vendetta held as a votive, not in vain, for the value and veracity of such shall one day vindicate the vigilant and the virtuous. Verily, this vichyssoise of verbiage veers most verbose, so let me simply add that it's my very good honor to meet you and you may call me "V".
author: V (V for Vendetta)

quoteText: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

quoteText: Don’t dream about what you want to do, stay awake and do it.
author: Marvin Yagoda

quoteText: When you have a hammer, everything looks like a nail.

quoteText: I don't ask you to love me always like this,but I ask you to remember.somewhere inside of me there will always be the person I am tonight
author: F Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.

quoteText: take a chance, while you've got the choice
every hour wounds, the last one kills

Rules are the definition of life.And once you get bored with your life....
Break those rules.
My life amounts to no more than one drop in a limitless ocean. Yet what is any ocean, but a multitude of drops?
author: David Mitchell, Cloud Atlas

quoteText: I'm a paradox.I want to be happy,but i think of things that make me sad.I'm lazy yet i'm ambitious.I dont like myself,but i also who i am.I say i dont care,but i really do.I crave attention,but reject it when it comes my way.I'm a conflicted contradiction.If I can't figure myself out,there's no way anyone else has.
The journey of a single step may start with a thousand miles in the opposite direction.
I always knew I could climb..but I could only climb if I climbed alone
author: Fountainhead

quoteText: If you love 2 people at the same time,choose the second one because if you really loved the first one u wouldn't fall for the second

quoteText: When a liar became too skilled at deception, he could lose the ability to discern truth, and could himself be more easily deceived.
author: Velocity ,Dean Koontz

quoteText: One cannot be prepared for something while secretly believing it will not happen
Never regret thy fall,O Icarus of the earless flight,For the greatest tragedy of them all is never to feel the burning light
author: Oscar Wilde

quoteText: In a pause,she asked How is he, Steve I often think that he's the only one whobhas achieved immortality.I dont mean in the sense of fame and I dont mean that he wont die someday.but he's living it.I think he is what the conception rrally means.yiu know how people long to be eternal.but they die wih every day that passes.when u meet them they are not what u met last..in any given hour, they kill some part of themselves.they change,they deny, they contradict-and they call ut growth. at the end  there's nothing left,nothing unreversed, or unbetrayed.as if there had never been an entity.only a succession of adjectives fading in and out on an unformed mass.how do they expect a permanence which they have never held fot a single moment?but howard-one can imagine him existing forever
author: Fountainhead -Ayn Rand

quoteText: Insanity is living ur life as nothing
author: Wanted : Morgan Freeman

quoteText: Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident
author: Louis de Bernières, Captain Corelli's Mandolin

quoteText: Hell happens when the evil of the world exceeds our belief that we can conquer it
author: Abyssinian (Da vinci's Demons)

quoteText:
You can have anything in life,
if you sacrifice everything for it

Nothing comes without a price,
So,before you go into battle,
you better decide how much you're willing to lose

An idealist is a coward who doesn’t understand enough of what his true thoughts and feelings mean and where, in time, they’ll lead him. So he sticks to thoughts, paths and philosophies which he knows the end result of…..



…… When an idealist says something that’s meant to get people laughing, you ought to pay attention. His humor reveals more than ‘a’ philosophy he understands. In humor lies the philosophy, his philosophy that he can’t quite grasp……

So which is it -

The unexamined life is not worth living

or

Ignorance is bliss?
Depression is merely anger without enthusiasm!!!

You got a dream..you gotta protect it.
People cant do something themselves,they wanna tell you you cant do it
if you want something,go get it.Period
author: In Pursuit of Happiness,Will Smith

Imagination will take you everywhere

quoteText: It opens the lungs, washes the countenance, exercises the eyes, and softens down the temper; so cry away.

quoteText: You can know the name of a bird in all the languages of the world, but when you're finished, you'll know absolutely nothing whatever about the bird. So let's look at the bird and see what it's doing -- that's what counts. I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
author: Richard Feynman

quoteText:

except the man who makes it
author: O.H Solumsmoen,ship vibration experience from service measurements

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quoteText: A true soulmate is probably the most important person you’ll ever meet, because they tear down your walls and smack you awake. But to live with a soulmate forever? Nah. Too painful. Soulmates, they come into your life just to reveal another layer of yourself to you, and then leave. A soulmate’s purpose is to shake you up, tear apart your ego a little bit, show you your obstacles and addictions, break your heart open so new light can get in, and make you so desperate and out of control that you have to transform your life.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quoteText: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them
author: Emerson

quoteText: In the end the Party would announce that two and two made five, and you would have to believe it. It was inevitable that they should make that claim sooner or later: the logic of their position demanded it. Not merely the validity of experience, but the very existence of external reality, was tacitly denied by their philosophy. The heresy of heresies was common sense. And what was terrifying was not that they would kill you for thinking otherwise, but that they might be right. For, after all, how do we know that two and two make four? Or that the force of gravity works? Or that the past is unchangeable? If both the past and the external world exist only in the mind, and if the mind itself is controllable-what then?
author: George Orwell-1984

quoteText: Thinking is one thing no one has ever been able to tax.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: If people are not laughing at your goals,your goals are too small
author: Azim Premji

quoteText: When you are face to face with a difficulty,you are up against a discovery

quoteText: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas

quoteText: For the happiness you want, what is the level  of pain you are willing to sustain
